page.title: 11Tarmacadam plant near Eryrys
page.content: A very modern tarmacadam plant, working since 1982, is sited within the area of Burley Hill Quarry. The plant produces bituminous sub-base, base and wearing course tarmacadams and asphalt. These products are used for road making, they are distributed to Clwyd, the North West and Midlands, by sheeted lorries. Production is by mixing various types and grades of stone with hot bitumen in a continuous rolling drum process. Stone from the quarry is used, hard stone, sand, bitumen and filler are brought in. Products can be stored for up to 12 hours in heated containers. The plant employes about 6 people and provides work for lorry drivers. The quarry, tarmacadam plant and resulting lorry traffic cause concern to some local residents.
